channel.title: Introduction :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: Node is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment build on Googleâ€™s V8 engine. It was created by Ryan Dahl in 2009 to allow for server-side scripting in JavaScript. ECMAScript Support Node supports most of the features of ECMAScript 2015 (ES6). However, Node dopated the CommonJS module approach before ES6 modules were proposed, and as a result uses CommonJS modules by default. To use ES6 modules instead, you must either:
